moves.1. e4: I always wonder if there will be a day when I have the courage to play 1.d4.
moves.2. d4: Go for the center whenever possible...
moves.2... d5 3. Nc3: Defends and develops at the same time.
moves.3... Bb4: Nice pin, trying to win a pawn.
moves.4. e5: Closing the position and saving the pawn temporarily.
moves.4... c5 5. Nf3 h6: Preventing the knight to go to g5.
moves.6. Bd2: Not avoiding an exchange but unpinning the knight on c3.
moves.6... cxd4 7. Nxd4 Bxc3 8. Bxc3 a6: Now that the dark-squared bishop is gone for black, it's very important to stop the knight from going to b5 and then a nasty Nd6 .
moves.9. Bd3 Ne7: f6 is not available for the black knight, so this would be plan B for developing that knight.
moves.10. O-O O-O 11. Qg4: I was not sure about this move. I probably made it as a waiting move.
moves.11... Nbc6: Forcing white's knight to make a decision or the e pawn will be gone.
moves.12. Nxc6 Nxc6: White has now to anticipate the threat ...d4
moves.13. f4: Defends the e pawn and prepares for an eventual opening of the f file.
moves.13... a5 14. Bd2: This might look like a mistake from white, but this will turn into a tricky position soon.
moves.15. Kh1 Qxb2 16. Rab1: I'm not sure why I'm giving away those pawns...
moves.16... Qxa2 17. Rbd1: The plan here was to move that rook from danger, since I was planning to bring my other rook to f3 and eventually to g3 or h3.
moves.17... f5: I wasn't expecting this move (not sure if it's good or bad).
moves.18. Qh4: If I go with 18.Qg6, then 18...Ne7 it's annoying and loses a tempo for white.
moves.18... Nd4: ?? The queen can now be trapped and white can win the exchange, a rook for the black queen!
moves.19. Rda1: The black queen will be gone! ...right?
moves.19... Nf3: !? Black realizes that his queen is about to be trapped! So black decides that it's better to lose the knight rather than losing the queen.
moves.20. gxf3: Not with the rook! As that would lose the exchange with 20...Qxa1
moves.24. Qh8+ Ke7: There's no other choice. This loses the g pawn for black and keeps the attack for white.
moves.25. Rxg7 b6: A futile attempt to bring the other rook to defend with a Bb7.
Exploiting every weakness to finish the job.
moves.29... Kf8 30. Bxd7: This will be the only non-check move from white. Black's fate is still imminent.
moves.30... Qc4 31. Qf6+: Mate in 3... I mean... mate in 2 and a half...
moves.31... Kg8 32. Rg1+ Kh7 33. Bxf5#: So may options to checkmate: 33.Qg7#, 33.Qh4#... This was a nice game, which secured me at least a fourth place on this mini-tourney.
